title: Retail price for granulated sugar in the U.S. 2000 to 2017
yAxis: Price per pound in U.S. cents
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Price per pound in U.S. cents, with a total of 18 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2012 to 2004.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2004 to 2000.
Conversely, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2015 to 2012.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2017 to 2015.
gold: In the United States , the average retail price per pound of granulated sugar was roughly 65 U.S. cents in 2017 . The price of sugar has fluctuated considerably over the past seventeen years , peaking at almost 70 U.S. cents per pound in 2012 . Sugar production Within the 2018/2019 period , a total of just under 180 million metric tons of sugar was produced worldwide .
